meanings.definition: To take possession of a property due to nonpayment of a mortgage.
meanings.sent1: The bank forecloses on houses when people do not pay their mortgages.
meanings.sent2: If you don't pay your mortgage, the bank can foreclose on your home.
meanings.sent3: The bank forecloses on the house, turning it into a pumpkin instead.
meanings.sent4: The bank's power to foreclose on properties is like a giant hand reaching down to claim what is owed.
meanings.sent5: The word 'forecloses' paints a picture of a locked door on a home, symbolizing financial trouble.

meanings.definition: To prevent the possibility of something happening.
meanings.sent1: Paying attention to safety rules can foreclose accidents in the workplace.
meanings.sent2: Wearing a seatbelt can foreclose the risk of injury in a car crash.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's quick action forecloses the evil plan from succeeding.
meanings.sent4: A good security system can foreclose the chances of a break-in at home.
meanings.sent5: The vaccine helps foreclose the spread of diseases, keeping the community healthy.
